intro: Leucanthemum pallens var. crassifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf white ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers with prominent white centers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It is a perennial species that produces a single flowering stem each year. The flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant is considered a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae).
